brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study was to assess the results of a Total Knee prosthesis specifically
      intended to enhance functional performance , especially in terms of physical and sports
      activity.

clinical_study.brief_title: Total Knee Replacement With the ROCC Knee

detailed_description.textblock:
Clinical and radiographic results , complications, early post-operative and late functional
      outcome and survivorship  were studied in a continuous prospective series of 500 patients (
      602 knees) managed using the ROCC knee ( BIOMET INC - Warsaw- IND, USA).

      A minimum follow-up  of 5 years was required.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  all patients receiving a total knee

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  patients with severe psychiatric, neurologic, cardiologic or locomotor pathology
             occuring after the total knee replacement

intervention.description: replacement of an osteoarthritic knee with a total knee prosthesis operation may be for a single knee ( unilateral) or both knees of a patient ( bilateral)
intervention.intervention_name: Total knee replacement with the ROCC® knee prosthesis

clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Study of Total Knee Replacement With the ROCC Knee

other_outcome.time_frame: at last follow-up examination, with minimum of 5 years after surgery

other_outcome.measure: positioning and quality of the fixation of a total knee replacement
